    • Field Detail

    • Constructor Detail

      • Exit

        Exit(java.lang.String dir,
     Room src,
     Room dest)
        Takes a String, and two Room objects to construct an Exit object. After initialization and assignments, the source Room object's addExit method is called to add the exit into the Room's exit data structure.
        Parameters:
        dir - direction of the exit with respect to the source room
        src - room object containing the exit
        dest - destination room object

      • Exit

        Exit(java.util.Scanner s,
     Dungeon d)
throws Exit.NoExitException,
     Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Given a Scanner object positioned at the beginning of an "exit" file entry, read and return an Exit object representing it.
        Parameters:
        d - The dungeon that contains this exit (so that Room objects may be obtained.)
        Throws:
        Exit.NoExitException - The reader object is not positioned at the start of an exit entry. A side effect of this is the reader's cursor is now positioned one line past where it was.
        IllegalDungeonFormatException - A structural problem with the dungeon file itself, detected when trying to read this room.
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException

        message describing the exits direction and destination

        Returns the Room which the exit is contained in.

        Returns the destination Room of the exit.
        Returns:
